newsitem.title: CANADA: Imperial Mount Polley mine near completion.
newsitem.headline: Imperial Mount Polley mine near completion.

text.p: Imperial Metals Corp said Friday it expects to complete construction on its Mount Polley gold-copper mine within a few weeks and begin producing concentrates by July.

President Pierre Lebel said the mine in central British Columbia would be finished five months earlier than scheduled. He also told shareholders at the company's annual meeting that the project was "going to be materially underbudget from our original targets."

The capital cost was originally estimated at C$123.5 million. Imperial has a 55 percent stake in the property and Japan's Sumitomo Corp the remainder. Sumitomo will also be the marketing agent for the concentrate.
The mine is forecast to produce 100,000 ounces of gold and 24 million pounds of copper a year for the first four years.
Lebel predicted Mount Polley will generate C$14 million to C$20 million a year in cash flow when production begins.

Imperial is also seeking to acquire another advanced exploration project to capitalize on its mine development skills, the company said. Most of its exploration efforts are focused on British Columbia.
